snippet: The fishermen were accused of violating Pakistan’s territorial waters in the Arabian Sea, the police said. Pakistan’s Maritime Security Agency also seized eight boats, which it said had strayed into Pakistani waters.
abstract: Pakistan's Maritime Security Agency apprehend 47 Indian fisherman and seize eight boats on allegations they violated territorial waters; arrests for this offense are frequently conducted by both countries because maritime border in Arabian Sea is vague and many fishing boats lack technology to determine location.
lead_paragraph: The fishermen were accused of violating Pakistan’s territorial waters in the Arabian Sea, the police said. Pakistan’s Maritime Security Agency also seized eight boats, which it said had strayed into Pakistani waters.
